answers.answer: Hi!Pain predominantly on the left side can be due to hypothyroidism which you have. Hence see if the thyroid is under control or not by getting a thyroid profile done. Other possibilities are fibromyalgia, chronic fatigue syndrome, severe anemia, spinal nerve compression high up in the cervical spine, ankylosing spondylitis, osteoarthritic changes of the vertebrae, calcium deficiency, low Vit D, electrolyte disturbance, peripheral neuropathy due to diabetes or due to bad posture. Lyme and lupus are the other possibilities. Do discuss this with your doctor and get yourself examined. Take care!

hello doctor,thanks for replying , i had an EMG done this week which was fine,i am having a mri on head and spine next week the doctor also did the following blood tests,  CK, LDH,LYME SEROLOGY, ANA, ENA ANCA ,FBC, CRP, ESR TPO, HHACCI do have low VIT D and am taking 1000iu of d3 for a month now,also low ferrtin.i have a 22yr old daughter dx with lupus sle 3 yrs agoand 18 yr daughter tested positive for tpo antibodies 2 weeks ago[she is now on 25 mcg eletroxin]i also have meniere[vertigo] since i was 12 yrs ,my dad had it too,i have not had an episode of this for around 22 yrs or soknow i have gone on a bit ,but maybe you might see a connection
